page.title: 09HOUSEWIFE OF PENSIONABLE AGE
page.content: Lived in Portchester for thirty four years although she is Australian by birth and British by adoption. Her main problem is one of increasing age. One national problem is "moonlighting" by people. This is when people do not pay taxes for jobs they do. This is unfair on others because it means they have to pay more to account for the deficit caused by the "moonlighters". She sees no solution unless people become more honest, but it is impossible to transform human nature. Local problems are vandalism, caused by lack of discipline at all levels. She does not think society is changing for the better, as people, and young people in particular seem to have little respect for anything or anyone.
